author: giezi
title: Link Start, the new social media
description: The world of blockchain continues to grow and so does the need for talent. Current recruiting sites don't cater to this market it needs too.

f6_assessments.q0: A great idea to start off with, there are few proposals in various other challenges that kind of target a similar problem statement. "Linkedin on Cardano" and many such proposals. They are all trying to achieve a common goal of making sure the market needs are fulfilled efficiently and also the talents are put to good use and for the right cause. The one thing that makes this proposal stand out amongst the others is the concept of social media which in turn provides means to access Twitter, discord channels, and hence there is a learning and engaging aspect to this product. The team is, however, mentions this to be just a mere concept and nothing is set in stone and is cautious about the risks involved which are positive. Hence, all in all, I score a 4 for the impact of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The action plan supporting the idea is very brief. The proposer provides a vague idea about what the community can expect during the project implementation. But there are no clear milestones and deliverables at each phase defined yet. Also, the requested fund is a pretty hefty amount and the breakdown being guesstimated is not doing any favor to the proposal's integrity. The proposer also mentions not having made any effort or research yet on the team that might be working on the proposal and hence I feel it very difficult to make any assumption on the feasibility of the proposal from the limited information available. Hence I would like to agree and disagree on that at the moment.
f6_assessments.q2: My sentiments to the measurable key metrics are pretty much the same as the feasibility parameters. The proposer has somewhat failed to identify the quantifiable metrics the community can use to measure the progress of the project. The proposer again makes claims about what they intend to do during their implementation and after that. The success criteria are also yet to be defined clearly, but since the submission is under "Miscellaneous challenge" the lack of crystal clear metrics and expectations to evaluate the validity of the proposal, I find it hard to agree with the proposal from the auditability perspective. I'm sure an elaborated proposal could have gained them some leverage over other proposals considering the unique approach they propose. Hence I suggest the proposer solidify their game plan that complements their brilliant idea and come back stronger if they fail to raise funds this time.

f6_assessments.q0: We observed that the Link Start platform has an objective that actually helps to expand the visibility of technologies that are in the scope of Cardano. However, we noticed that both the main function of the platform and the secondary function apparently do not need these technologies in themselves to be implemented. In this way, the proposal does not seem to fit the goals of the challenge. Likewise, the idea is not very innovative; despite the main focus being a tool to recruit professionals involved with web technologies3 and also to find tools from this universe, we were not able to perceive a great impact or innovation with the creation of this platform in the way we proposed. Overall, this doesn't seem like a project that fits the goals aligned by the DApps and Integrations challenge, just as the requested budget of $63,000 seems too high.
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding the feasibility plan, we also noticed that the strategy aims to build a platform in the web2 version so that the product is validated before the transition to a Dapp. However, given the ideas described in the proposal, there seem to be no clear reasons why the idea, once validated in the web2 version, needs to be migrated. Thus, some points developed here could be used to build a product whose scope was really the web2 version. Such points would be the validation with 600 users that was mentioned or the use of the heat map to better understand the operation of the project.

Although in some parts of the proposal some strategies were mentioned, such as the use of smart contracts to bring greater security to the data, it seems that all the project's objectives can be achieved without using such concepts and technologies inherent to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: We noticed that, in general terms, good metrics were established to track the results of a project, such as the establishment of a test group for a beta version of the platform and a number to be reached that represents the project's user base. However, once again we emphasize that it seems nicer that the scope of the project is aimed at web2 versions, since the dissemination of information is the central point of this platform and apparently it is not necessary to use more complex tools to achieve this objective.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer wants to implement 2 ideas under same proposal where the first one is for web developing enthusiast towards block chain, as there is limited number of dApps to recruit for Web3 applicants, this model definitely boosts all the people who want to have course in Web3 developments.
The other idea presented is of bringing all the webs or apps which provide latest updates related to block chain under same tree where the user can drag drop the required webs and can remove if needed, this will provide great flexibility and removes head ache of opening multiple tabs , hence This proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has four years of experience in the blockchain and  e-commerce space. and has  fulfilled over 1M orders through his sites and specialize in consumer data aggregation and marketing. The proposer has already gained the required experience in block chain and know the market works, the proposer even knows what is demand present in the market, so he is setting up a platform where people can show interest and get jobs for specifically web 3 development and have all the block chain news platforms under one platform, with the great experience and idea presented plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer should have introduced team with whom he'll be working with, since the job cannot be completed by one person and it would have reduced the time required for recruitment of members for the project.
The roadmap doesn't contain at what time each step will be completed , by this there might be  lag in achieving each tasks at the given time. The proposal even contains con's of the project that might arise , the budget breaking is very clear hence the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Although blockchain has been around for a long time, professions from this field have only been formed recently as more and more people learn and devote full time to this field. Your ideas are very welcome. I am impressed that you analyze some of the current recruitment platforms and their shortcomings, although these are not professional research papers, it shows that you have invested in researching and creating a recruiting platform. your own use.
I see 2 highlights here:
Web3 application to your platform allows employers and hires to work directly with each other through smart contracts. This is an inevitable trend in the not too distant future.
You want to completely automate this process and don't know how to generate an automatic revenue for your website. You can create and detail the recruitment process to see how many steps it includes, and each step you can charge a very cheap fee for each activity on the website."
f6_assessments.q1: This is a not bad project idea but quite a lot of tasks to complete it, but you are alone without any teammates. Moreover the expenses are a bit much compared to the jobs you indicated. I hope you will have to adjust these 2 factors to be more suitable. The rest of the presentations are detailed and enough to seriously judge that you want to implement these dapps and take advantage of cardano's features including defi and web3 payments.
f6_assessments.q2:
"In this section (AUDITABILITY) you need to outline how you will report your work progress, your detailed quarterly/monthly target numbers. This makes your project more visualized for the reader, and shows the transparency of your project. You have presented some numbers but it should be more detailed and convincing.
And if possible you can have media channels and official website for your project. Good luck!"

f6_assessments.q0:
I agree that this proposal is a great fit for another challenging topic. The proposed idea is to create an application that consists of two parts: one is a career recruitment application for Web 3, the second part is this application. aims to be a solution for managing a multitude of apps and websites that many in the space are already using to discover new and up-to-date information about the blockchain world. The proposed proposals are presented clearly, and the scope, development output and success measures have been carefully outlined.
In addition, the proponent has measured possible risks and devised contingency tactics if anything does not go according to plan, which is a plus of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
To increase the credibility and feasibility of this proposal, I would like this proposal to include a little more information about the team and the developers working on the project. With regards to knowing who is involved in the project, what is presented in this proposal description is that the proponent has four years of experience in the blockchain and e-commerce space, other than that there is no information to confirm. (minus 1 point)
While the proposal provides a detailed blueprint, it will be difficult to track the progress and success of this project as the proposal does not provide a road map with verifiable landmarks and a definite timeframe. determined. (minus 1 point)
Asking for $63000, I think this is a good number to recommend. It is also told how the financial amount will be used, in a very specific way.
f6_assessments.q2: I think by providing metrics, they have a solid plan to measure success and deliver the product. KPIs are very clear and fit the definition of success. This way the testability is done well, there is enough detail to understand how things are going and how we can track them. This is a new project that has never been mentioned before and is not a continuation of previous Catalyst projects.

f6_assessments.q0: The presenter has put forward a solution out of expectation in all of the challenges. However, the presenter does not need to post this proposal in both Miscellaneous and DApps and Intergration challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Currently, it is hard to speak about the presenter's experience since this is an early stage of this project. The presenter has not found a team to support the project's implementation. However, I think there is a demand for this solution, and the presenter has proved this by giving related data. If enough experience is gained, a good founding team is formed, and enough resources are allocated, this proposal could be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I am pleased with the details of this proposal. The technical aspects of the project are clearly explained. I have an informative and reasonable budget breakdown that has considered everything from technology to operation and marketing. The presenter pinpoints the challenge that the team could face during real-world implementation and provides workable solutions to solve it. The goals that the team needs to achieve to implement this project successfully are clear and well-thought-out. I think this is a great proposal in terms of details and informativity.

solution: A new recruiter tool for Web3 specifically that helps new uses discover tools and that provides vetting service for existing users.
experience: I have four years of experience in the blockchain and  e-commerce space. I have fulfilled over 1M orders through my sites and specialize in consumer data aggregation and marketing. I understand business development and have been on the advertising end of social media.
